results.title: Safe on the road
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
The number of road accidents resulting in death or severe injuries is increasing. Statistics of road accidents are given and the film stresses the need for responsible attitudes by all road users. The necessity for using all available safety precautions is emphasised.

results.title: Safe in the water
results.brief_description: Water should be fun and if the rules are observed you can be safe in the water. Dramatised episodes show the most frequent causes of water accidents involving children. Details precautions that should be taken, and rescue techniques. Emphasises the importance of learning to swim at an early age. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Water should be fun and if the rules are observed you can be safe in the water. Dramatised episodes show the most frequent causes of water accidents involving children. results.title: Safe in the snow
results.creator_credit: Cinesound, British Petroleum and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: The ski rescue service is made up of volunteers, well-trained in search and rescue, first aid and transportation of the injured. Shows the work of the safety patrols in the winter, and sports centres in New South Wales and Victoria. Stresses the need for suitable clothing, well made skis and adequate care when skiing.

results.title: Safe in nature
results.brief_description: Dramatizes two examples of young people getting lost in the woods and in the desert, pointing out what the people did wrong while lost and what they should have done. Information is given on conserving energy and body moisture as well as many other aspects of bushcraft for survival

results.title: Safe handling of food in quantity
results.creator_credit: Richard Turner and New York State College of Home Economics
results.brief_description: Discusses food poisoning and measures to prevent it for those employed in handling food. Demonstrates control of bacteria by avoiding contamination, temperature regulation and chemical methods.

results.brief_description: Made for the International Documentation for Heating and Ventilation Joint Safety Committee, the film gives the correct methods of lifting and moving materials manually.

results.title: Safe for life (E)
results.creator_credit: Svend Johansen, Filmforsyningen, Denmark. National Board of Health and Liller Moller
results.brief_description: The AIDS epidemic is one which affects both the heterosexual and homosexual community - and being young isn’t a guarantee of immunity, in fact the young are probably one of the most vulnerable groups. Using clever animation, this production broaches the topic of AIDS prevention through the careful use of the condom, the only known way of avoiding the disease. WARNING: THE MATERIAL IS VISUALLY EXPLICIT.

results.title: Safe driving: a question of attitude
results.creator_credit: Peter Dimond, South Australian Film Corporation, Max Pepper and Pepper Audio Visual
results.brief_description: In a series of dramatised sequences the importance of developing sensible attitudes to driving a motor vehicle is clearly presented. Aggressive and timid drivers, speeding away from traffic lights, poor driving techniques, “tailgating” and drink-driving are all dealt with.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Dimond, South Australian Film Corporation, Max Pepper and Pepper Audio Visual

results.title: Safe closing down procedures
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Gas Welding”
This program covers oxyacetylene equipment and closing down procedures. The material is presented as a step-by-step demonstration.
